io.netty.channel

Class MessageList<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.channel.MessageList<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<T>

    public final class MessageList<T>
extends Object
implements Iterable<T>
    Datastructure which holds messages. You should call recycle() once you are done with using it.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      MessageList<T> add(MessageList<T> src)
      Add the messages contained in the given MessageList to this MessageList and return itself.
      MessageList<T> add(MessageList<T> src, int srcIdx, int srcLen)
      Add the messages contained in the given MessageList, using the given src index and src length, to this MessageList and return itself.
      MessageList<T> add(T value)
      Add the message to this MessageList and return itself.
      MessageList<T> add(T[] src)
      Add the messages contained in the array to this MessageList and return itself.
      MessageList<T> add(T[] src, int srcIdx, int srcLen)
      Add the messages contained in the array, using the given src index and src length, to this MessageList and return itself.
      <U> MessageList<U> cast() 
      MessageList<T> clear()
      Clear all messages and return itself.
      boolean containsOnly(Class<?> clazz)
      Returns true if all messages contained in this MessageList are assignment-compatible with the object represented by this Class.
      MessageList<T> copy()
      Create a new copy all messages of this MessageList and return it.
      MessageList<T> copy(int index, int length)
      Create a new copy all messages of this MessageList, starting at the given index and using the given len, and return it.
      boolean forEach(int index, int length, MessageListProcessor<? super T> proc) 
      boolean forEach(MessageListProcessor<? super T> proc) 
      T get(int index)
      Return the message on the given index.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Return true if this MessageList is empty and so contains no messages.
      Iterator<T> iterator() 
      static <T> MessageList<T> newInstance()
      Create a new empty MessageList instance
      static <T> MessageList<T> newInstance(int minCapacity)
      Create a new empty MessageList instance with the given capacity.
      static <T> MessageList<T> newInstance(T value)
      Create a new MessageList instance which holds the given value
      boolean recycle()
      Clear and recycle this instance.
      boolean releaseAll()
      Call ByteBufUtil.release(Object) on all messages in this MessageList and return true if all messages were released.
      boolean releaseAll(int decrement)
      Call ByteBufUtil.release(Object, int) on all messages in this MessageList and return true if all messages were released.
      boolean releaseAllAndRecycle()
      Short-cut for calling releaseAll() and recycle().
      boolean releaseAllAndRecycle(int decrement)
      Short-cut for calling releaseAll(int) and recycle().
      MessageList<T> retainAll()
      Call ByteBufUtil.retain(Object) on all messages in this MessageList and return itself.
      MessageList<T> retainAll(int increment)
      Call ByteBufUtil#retain(Object), int on all messages in this MessageList and return itself.
      MessageList<T> set(int index, T value)
      Sets the message on the given index.
      int size()
      Return the current size of this MessageList and so how many messages it holds.

      • releaseAll

        public boolean releaseAll()
        Call ByteBufUtil.release(Object) on all messages in this MessageList and return true if all messages were released.

      • releaseAll

        public boolean releaseAll(int decrement)
        Call ByteBufUtil.release(Object, int) on all messages in this MessageList and return true if all messages were released.

      • releaseAllAndRecycle

        public boolean releaseAllAndRecycle()
        Short-cut for calling releaseAll() and recycle(). Returns true if both return true.

      • releaseAllAndRecycle

        public boolean releaseAllAndRecycle(int decrement)
        Short-cut for calling releaseAll(int) and recycle(). Returns true if both return true.

        Clear and recycle this instance.

        Return the current size of this MessageList and so how many messages it holds.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Return true if this MessageList is empty and so contains no messages.

      • get

        public T get(int index)
        Return the message on the given index. This method will throw an IndexOutOfBoundsException if there is no message stored in the given index.
